column14: An excellent helper. With cloud services that are accessed through tokens & keys becoming the de-facto Internet infrastructure, such bots can put developers at ease while filing reports.

column15: there might be cases where a replier manipulates the issuer to give away types of code snippets that are yet to be untrained (by convincing them that given snippet are not enough to describe the issue) but can still be dangerous to share. updating the tool after every long phases of application will help to identify those.

column15:
1. It can pinpoint the leaks (I am not sure if it already does this now, because on my end I could not see the specific red underlines, the red dot at the top right corner was available though). 
2. It can also suggest the final issue after removing the flawed part. Otherwise, while removing the secret, the remaining message or code snippet might not be meaningful/working.
